alert.note: Alert for Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 01 at 3:01AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY UNTIL MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of the northern mountains and southern Front Range Foothills. * WHEN...From Noon until midnight MDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and burn areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Another round of heavy rain producing thunderstorms can be expected again this afternoon and evening. Stronger storms will be capable of producing 1.5 to 2 inches of rain in 45 minutes or less.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet
